results.title: Something wicked this way comes
results.creator_credit: Jack Clayton, Peter Vincent Douglas and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: A stranger known as Mr. Dark brings his evil travelling carnival to a small town and the task of saving family and friends from its destructive clutches falls upon a boy and his father, the town librarian. Based on Ray Bradbury’s novel of the same name. Cast includes Jason Robards, Jonathan Pryce, Diane Ladd, Pam Grier, Vidal Peterson.

results.title: South Africa belongs to us
results.creator_credit: Chris Austin, Gerhard Schmidt Produktion and Westdeutscher Rundfunk
results.brief_description: A film about black women in South Africa filmed secretly with the help of two black women journalists. Through interviews with five typical women, and comments from four women activists, including Winnie Mandela, the film clearly shows the devastating impact of apartheid on black women and their families. Narration by Peggy Phango.

results.title: Soon there will be no more me
results.brief_description: Her daughter had just been born and Lyn Helton was still 19 years old when whe learned that she had a fatal type of cancer. In whatever time she had left, Lyn was determined to write a book of hope to be left to the world. Most of all it would be a way to communicate with her daughter who some day would want to know the mother she couldn’t remember. The soundtrack of the film consists of excerpts from Lyn’s unfinished book.

results.title: Sony Digital Handycam DCR-VX1000
results.brief_description: Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 in 1995, the same year digital video launched. It wasn’t just popular for amateurs and at-home users, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking to replace the large, expensive, shoulder mounted Betacam cameras.

constellations_primary.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.description: Digital video was launched in 1995 and Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 that same year. It was not only hugely popular for the amateur and at-home user, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking for something to replace the large, expensive, shoulder-mounted Betacam cameras. The camcorder was the answer, with high image quality matched by its affordability and portability. These same traits are what saw it became a seminal tool for the creation of skate cinema, with the Handycam DCR-VX1000 often paired with a fish-eye lens and used to record groundbreaking videos in the genre.
description_for_label: Digital video was launched in 1995 and Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 that same year. It was not only hugely popular for the amateur and at-home user, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking for something to replace the large, expensive, shoulder-mounted Betacam cameras. The camcorder was the answer, with high image quality matched by its affordability and portability. These same traits are what saw it became a seminal tool for the creation of skate cinema, with the Handycam DCR-VX1000 often paired with a fish-eye lens and used to record groundbreaking videos in the genre.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-05. Camera Tech → MM-05-C01

results.title: Sony Betamovie BMC-100P
results.brief_description: This Sony Betamovie BMC-100P model of camera carried Betamax cassette tapes, which were introduced by Sony in 1975. It was the first consumer camcorder, including both camera and recorder in a single unit that would become standard in the years to follow.

constellations_primary.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_primary.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

results.description: The late 1970s to 1980s were a time of voracious competition and innovation for companies attempting to gain a monopoly on the growing home video market. This Sony Betamovie BMC-100P model of camera carried Betamax cassette tapes, which were introduced by Sony in 1975. It was the first consumer camcorder, including both camera and recorder in a single unit that would become standard in the years to follow. The rival Betamax and VHS (Video Home System) formats were incompatible with each other, meaning buyers had to choose. The advantages of Betamax were its slightly superior picture quality and smaller size, but the length of recording time was considerably shorter than VHS.
description_for_label: The late 1970s to 1980s were a time of voracious competition and innovation for companies attempting to gain a monopoly on the growing home video market. The rival Betamax and VHS (Video Home System) formats were incompatible with each other, meaning buyers had to choose. The advantages of Betamax were its slightly superior picture quality and smaller size, but the length of recording time was considerably shorter than VHS.

results.title: Songs of innocence: a child's view of family life
results.creator_credit: Gordon Glenn, Patricia Edgar and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: 13 young children of varying ages share their delightfully frank observations about events that have changed their lives. Danielle, 10, attends the birth of her new sibling. Angus, 6, has just received a new baby sister and it’s affecting the amount of time he gets to spend with mum. Nicholas, 9, and his sister have an upbringing that involves a lot of musical and sporting extra curricular activities. Three Turkish sisters Pelin, Sermin, Suna have lived in an inner city high-rise since emigrating from Turkey 8 years ago. Kendel, 11, is an only child with parents who work long hours. Andrew and Sarah have parents who both work and discuss routines and discipline. Tessie, 8, lives with her mother following her parent’s divorce. She describes what it was like when her father left and when her mother started seeing someone else. Richard, 12, has lived with his father since his parents divorced and his father is about to remarry. Troy (13) and Amanda (12) live with their grandmother and aunt. Their mother lives in New Zealand and they didn’t know their fathers. Speaking with candour, the children show remarkable insight into the dynamics of the family. Please note: child birth scene

results.title: Song of the south
results.creator_credit: Harve Foster, Wilfred Jackson, Perce Pearce, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: In the years just after the Civil War, young Johnny (Bobby Driscoll) is sent to live at the southern plantation of his grandmother (Lucile Watson) while his parents contemplate divorce. At first disconsolate, the boy is cheered up by African-American handyman Uncle Remus (James Baskett), who tells him many delightful fables concerning the clever trickster Br’er Rabbit, whose adventures are illustrated in cartoon form. Based on the popular ‘Uncle Remus’ stories of Joel Chandler Harris and blending live action with cell animation, ‘Song of the South’ is an American classic, both loved for its popular songs and seamless technique, and reviled for its condescending depiction of African-Americans. Also starring Hattie MacDaniel.

results.title: Song of the shirt
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Curling, Sue Clayton and Film and History Project
results.brief_description: An examination of the clothing industry in mid nineteenth century England, its organisation, the distribution and exploitation of female labour, and the representation of this process in the media. Using dramatised scenes, stills and video material, this traces the development of a chain of seamstresses’ workshops, linked to a central wholesaler. The system, in force from the 1830’s onwards, is shown to depend on the rigorous subdivision of labour and the principle of paying just enough to keep the labour force above the starvation level. The films is divided into 3 parts, plus postscript, each dealing with one aspect of the total history. Cast includes Martha Gibson, Paul Bentel, Geraldine Pilgrim, Frazer Cains and Anne McNiff.

results.title: Somerset Maugham's Quartet
results.creator_credit: Arthur Crabtree, Harold French, Ken Annakin, Ralph Smart, Antony Darnborough, Gainsborough Pictures and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Somerset Maugham himself introduces these adaptations of his short stories. “The Facts of Life”: a highly entertaining story about a young man’s trip to Monte Carlo, where he ignores his father’s parting advice, and emerges from the experience better off. “The Alien Corn”: a young man (Dirk Bogarde) is determined to become a concert pianist, despite his parents’ objections. “The Kite”: Herbert’s marriage falls apart because of his obsession with flying kites. “The Colonel’s Lady”: a stuffy retired colonel is baffled by the discovery that his wife has a reputation as a passionate poetess.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Crabtree, Harold French, Ken Annakin, Ralph Smart, Antony Darnborough, Gainsborough Pictures and Rank Film Productions

results.title: Song of the canary
results.brief_description: Coal miners once took caged canaries into the mines. By collapsing and dying, the tiny birds warned of the presence of deadly gases. Today workers themselves have become the canaries for other workers and society as a whole. The film examines lethal industrial-linked disease in factory workers as well as management and official indifference to this problem.
